intro: Galeopsis leiotricha, commonly known as lesser hedge-nettle, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Europe, Asia, and North America. It typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm and has opposite, ovate to lanceolate leaves with hairy surfaces. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers in clusters, which are often surrounded by bracts. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in fields, roadsides, and waste areas. Galeopsis leiotricha is characterized by its stinging hairs, which can cause skin irritation upon contact.
